revision.text: {{I|{{{1|0}}}|2}};This template is a '''typing aid''' convenience shortform template of the calls '''{{Tlx|Indent|(((1}}}|2}}}''' and its shortform equivalent '''{{I|{{{1}}}|2}}''', and any of the three causes a double linefeed without shifting indentation with no first parameter. The equivalent form of '''{{Tlx|I2}}''' to perform identically is just that... '''{{Tlx|I2}}''' no parameters. Like '''{{Tlx|I}}''' and '''{{Tlx|Indent}}''', '''{{Tlx|I2|{{{1}}}}}''' when given the argument '''{{{1}}}''', will indent that many spaces in the newline. The difference is '''{{I2}}''' always gives two linefeeds creating extra vertical {{WD|whitespace}}. {{Indent family usage}}

#REDIRECT [[Template:Wdy]]{{Interwikitmp-grp |V=5 |wqt=|wdy=|wsr=|mdw=|wvy= |!{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}}}}{{R from other template|Wdy}}<!-- this formerly was the old working template named template:WD, now moved to Wdy standard three letter mnemonics --->

<!--- Template:Wdy ---><noinclude> '''{{Tl|Wdy}} accesses a dictionary page''' from any {{Mta|Sister projects|sister project}} and gives a user friendly pipetricked format for interwiki linking direct to access a {{wpd|Wiktionary}} page. </noinclude><includeonly>{{#ifeq: {{SITENAME}}|Wiktionary|{{#if:{{{2|}}}|[[{{{1}}}|{{{2}}}]] |[[{{{1}}}|{{{1}}}]]}} |{{#if:{{{2|}}}|[[wiktionary:{{{1}}}|{{{2}}}]] |[[wiktionary:{{{1}}}|{{{1}}}]]}} }}</includeonly><!--- ----- ----><noinclude> ---- Mnemonically, ''''W'''' from '''W'''iki plus ''''dy'''' for '''D'''ictionar'''y''': {{wpd|initialism|(An initialism)}}: Gives pipetricked form for ''inline'' interwiki linking direct to access a Wiktionary page.
;This macro displays the same link, in the format no matter what the sister project [[m:Help:Magic word |<nowiki>{{{SITENAME}}}</nowiki>]]. It's also used by [[M:WPTSP|Meta:WikiProject Template sharing]] to make usage text portable.<!--- ----- ---->{{Wikimacro usage}}<!--- ----- ----></noinclude>

revision.text:
{{-}} ''This 'Indent_family_usage' template documentation is [[w:Wikipedia:Template doc page pattern|transcluded]] for all {{Lts| Indent family usage }} tagged templates'' [[{{fullurl:Template:Indent family usage|action=edit}} edit]].{{#ifeq:{{SITENAME}}|Wikipedia| |[[W:template:{{PAGENAMEE}}|Masterpage]]  }} {{template doc page viewed directly}} {{interwikitmp-grp|V=0|cats=|inhib=yes|{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Typing-aid templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Formatting templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Templates using ParserFunctions|{{PAGENAME}}]] {{Interwikitmp-grp|V=4 |SYS=yes|cat=typing-aid templates |{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}} }}{{I0}} :Ver: D-- bold Formatting, add notation and documentation on [[template 2]] [[User:Fabartus|Fra]][[User talk:Fabartus|nkB]] 14:58, 5 April 2007 (UTC) :Ver: C-- (Mn) fx interwiki link, delete extra /noinclude at bottom -- [[User:Fabartus|Fra]][[User talk:Fabartus|nkB]] 13:04, 9 February 2007 (UTC) :Ver: B-- nesting fix [[User:Fabartus|Fra]][[User talk:Fabartus|nkB]] 09:31, 9 February 2007 (UTC) :Ver: A-- V=4 call revision, [[User:Fabartus|Fra]][[User talk:Fabartus|nkB]] 05:19, 3 February 2007 (UTC) ;This template is called as usage notes by the {{I0}}entire family of templates using Indent logic: {{I0}}It also auto-categories them and tags all the same {{I0}}with the same interwikitmp-grp template and categories. :Split out of {{lts|Indent}} at this date and time. {{I0}}// [[User:Fabartus|Fra]][[User talk:Fabartus|nkB]] 20:12, 2 January 2007 (UTC) See {{wpd|template talk:indent}} for a demonstration of the various formating features within wiki-markup that this family of templates makes available to editors. ==Usage== ;This is common usage: located in {{lts|Indent family usage}} for the small family of typing-aid and formatting templates calling {{Tlx|Indent}}. For the specific differences and behaviors, see the entry for this '{{Tlx|{{PAGENAME}}|nn}}' template below. * Within [[w:wikimarkup|wikimarkup]], a 'wrapped-newline' means it will indent to align with line beginning formatting commands such as {{I0}}'''':#', ':::::', '::**' '''etcetera. {{I2}}As any second argument (parameter) to 'indent' will produce a second double wrapped newline— '''this gives the capacity for adding vertical whitespace to paragraph organized test stream even when deeply indented by successive numberized (or not) sub-paragraphs. This useful behavior has earned itself it's own [[w:hardcode|hardcode]]d [[template:2]] with a conveniently shorter name. Placing this at the end of a formated line, begins the next line with inherited indentation and font features, but with double-spaced appearance. {{indent|5}}'''{{Indent|nn}}, {{Indent|nn|''anything''}}''' takes a numeric argument 'nn' after the pipe and provides that many ('nn') consecutive spaces like {{Tlx|Space}} (or 'S' and 'SP'). {{I2}}Indent differs from {{tl|space}} only in that '''''it automatically begins a wrapped-newline''', then spaces over ''''nn'''' spaces'', whereas {{tl|space}} spaces over 'nn' in the same (current) line. {{I2}}Consequently, this template can not be used inline to create alignment between adjacent text lines, or to space out titles, etc. Use {{tl|space}} for such needs. {{I2|5}} However, the wrapped-newline generated is not the same as an HTML
(or hard return) newline, but instead one which returns left to the margin of'' 'whatever indentation level' is in effect ''in expansion of the text block built using wiki markup language set by the familiar ''control characters'' ':', '*', or '#', and their legal combinations, like ':*', '**', ':#' and etc. * A '''feature of note''' in this family is that text formatting commands like bold or italic text carry over past the application of the template through and past the so called 'wrapped newline'. Hence these (related) templates have many uses in block quotes. Wiki-markup would require each paragraph displayed to individually be text effect formatted. Judicious use of these can save a lot of time and effort. Note the clarity and vertical separation of the numberized list following in related family members. * The actual number of resulting 'displayed' spaces in these templates or those depending upon {{TL|Space}} is highly browser and font selection dependent, due to the way it treats a given text line and tries to compact whitespace, uses partial width characters in the font, etcetera. {{I}}In general, lining things of unequal length up in a column gives a near miss to the ideal, being a somewhat wavy column differing by partial spaces given the letters in a font. It is however just a near miss, and quite useful. ==Related family members== ;Most of these call {{tlx|indent}} directly, :and using {{TLX|indent}} 'directly' itself is rare as 'I', 'I0', 'I2', 'I5' is much shorter and more compact. (Which attribute is certainly desirable in a ''typing aide''.){{I2}} # '''{{Tlx|I}}''' -- calls indent with a default of three spaces, or passes on an argument if other padding is desirable whist remaining more compact inside a block of text. {{i}}This line begins with an {{tl|I}} call. Note the indented nature and truncation of the line preceding. {{I}}In sum, {{TL|I}} terminates the sentence immediately preceeding, and starts a newline with an indented first line. Subsequent wrapped lines, wrap to whatever wiki markup paragraph control characters is in effect on the text block. This makes it versitile and useful for signed posts and involved discussions on wiki talk pages. {{i}}(Also Very useful in tables where edit-jumble is a factor, or on talks to create indented paragraph beginings inside a wiki indented ':', '::', '::*', or a '#' prefixed line).{{I}}Can also be given a second perameter such as '''{{Tlx|I|15|2}}''' in which case, acts identical to '''{{tlx|I2|15}}''' below... both these examples causing a fifteen space indentation.{{I2}} # '''{{tlx|I0}}''' -- that's ''eye-zero'', not (the two letters) ''eye-Oh'' -- Spaces down one line like 'i' preventing additional wrapping, but lining up with whatever inherited indentation comes from wiki markup control characters '*', ':', '#', etc. are operative. It's most frequently used to restore indentation to the 'normal indent' immediately following something doubly indented by '**' or '##' using the sequence construct: '''{{I}}":{{tlx|I0}}''' ''continuation text in the discussion''"
{{#ifexist:template 2|
# '''{{Tlx|2}}''' is strictly speaking not part of this family as it does not connect to {{tl|indent}} under any use condition. However, functionally it is effectively the sub-template that is used in the {{tl|I2}} below to generate double-spacing. Unlike {{tl|I2}}, it will Subst cleanly and easily if needed. (In general calls to {{tl|indent}} are best left as a template without substitution.){{I2}}|
}} # '''{{Tlx|I2}}''' -- performs a second linefeed similar to

in a line, but retains the inherited indent in a text block, and like I0, does not actually indent the first line unless given a second perameter. This creates vertical whitespace that was a common [[w:misnomer|misnomer]] (commonly misnamed) 'double spaced' paragraphs in the days of typewriters before WYSIWIG and word processing. It make keeping presentations clear easy and painless.{{I2}} #'''{{tlx|I5}}''' -- Same as I, but using a default of five spaces extra indentation in and after single newline effect within wiki markup paragraphs indented flow. ==Example calls== * '''{{TLX|I2|5}}'''-- precedes the sentence begining: ''However, the newline generated...'' early in the text above. * '''{{tl|I}}'''-- use is illustrated above immediately preceding the paragraphs beginning '''"{Very useful..."''' and '''"Consequently, this template..."''', as well as several other places which should be obvious as the lines are indented three spaces one line down. * '''{{indent|2}}, {{space|7}}, etc. '''...{{i|5}}'''space''' and '''indent''' are limited to adding '''30 spaces'''.

{{Indent|0}}<noinclude> ;This template generates a single line feed with no indentation, :except that which it inherits from wiki paragraph created indents in the same 'logical paragraph'. That is like all the indent derivatives, (I2, I), it maintains any indentation created in a text block by ':', '*', or '#' or their legal combinations. {{Indent family usage}} <!-- Indent family usage also cats all these the same way ---></noinclude>

:''main discussion & Queries: [[w:template talk:Lts|template talk:Lts]] [[category:template documentation]] {{Interwikitmp-grp|{{PAGENAME}} }} == Documentation == [[W:Template:Lts]], [[M:Template:Lts]], etc. on various [[w:Sister projects|Sister projects ]] are a smaller variant of {{tlxm|Lt}} with pleasant output, for use especially also on browsers which don't support [[W:interpunct|·]]. === Usage === {{Lts|template}} shows links for the specified template.
{{Lts}} shows links for a template wrt the {{PAGENAME}}. === Example === {| | '''Code''' || '''Result''' |- | {{Lts|Lt}} | {{Lts|Lt}} |- | {{Lts}} | {{Lts}} |}{{-}} === See also === {| | {{Lts|Lts}} || for templates |- | {{Lts|Lcs}} || for categories |- | {{Lts|Lps}} || for {{ns:Project}} (= {{ns:Project}}) |- | {{Lts|Ltsmeta}} || for templates copied from [[m:|Meta]] |- | {{Lts|Lts/}} || for template lists (see below) |- | {{Lts|Lx}} || boilerplate for the Lx family |- | [[:Category:Internal link templates]] || for a [[#Comparison|comparison]] of this zoo see below |- | colspan="2" | {{Ltsmeta|Lps}} |- | colspan="2" | {{Ltsmeta|Lts}} |- | colspan="2" | {{Ltsmeta|Ltsmeta}} |}{{-}} === Comparison === We got a zoo of similar templates, pick what you like. This list is probably incomplete and intentionally omits variants with parameters like {{Tlx|Tlx}} and redirections like {{Tlx|Tln}}: {| | '''Source''' || '''Code''' || '''Result''' |- | {{Lts/|lt}} | {{lt|x4}} | {{lt|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|lts}} | {{lts|x4}} | {{lts|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|lts/}} | {{lts/|x4}} | {{lts/|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|tetl}} | {{tetl|x4}} | {{tetl|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|ti}} | {{ti|x4}} | {{ti|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|tic}} | {{tic|x4}} | {{tic|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|tiw}} | {{tiw|x4}} | {{tiw|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|tl}} | {{tl|x4}} | {{tl|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|tls}} | {{tls|x4}} | {{tls|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|tlsetl}} | {{tlsetl|x4}} | {{tlsetl|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|tlt}} | {{tlt|x4}} | {{tlt|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|ttl}} | {{ttl|x4}} | {{ttl|x4}} |- | {{Lts/|twlh}} | {{twlh|x4}} | {{twlh|x4}} |}{{-}}

[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]] This is a common usage page for the sister [[w:macro|macro]] templates: {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Wpd|Wpd]]}} / {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Wbk|Wbk]]}} / {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Cms|Cms]]}} / {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Wdy|Wdy]]}} / {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Wqt|Wqt]]}} / {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Wsp|Wsp]]}} / {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Wsr|Wsr]]}} / {{[[{{ns:Template}}: Wvy|Wvy]]}} etcetera. 
This page takes numeric parameters thru which normal control mnemonics may be defined.
{{#if:{{{1|}}}||{{{1}}}={{#if:{{{2|}}}||{{{2}}}=}}{{#if:{{{3|}}}||{{{3}}}=}}{{#if:{{{4|}}}||{{{4}}}=}}}}... these act as inputs to interwikitmp-grp


This page takes one other parameter:

    RDIR = defined or not defined, 
    ... use this on redirects pages of the old templates names
    now redirects such as 'W2', 'W2c', 'Wd', 'WD', and 'Mw', etc.
    and include this page instead of using direct inclusions of 
    interwikitmp-grp. This provides for one place to update and maintain
    auto-catgegorization and participating sister projects, etc.
    
    When RDIR defined, properly pipetricks PAGENAME to indicate redirects pages.
{{interwikitmp-grp |V=D |cat=Template documentation |inhib=yes |wdy=|wqt=|wsr= |{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}}}}{{#if:{{{RDIR|}}}|[[Category:Typing-aid templates|!{{PAGENAME}}]] | [[Category:Typing-aid templates |{{PAGENAME}}]] }} [[Category:Interwiki link templates |{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Utility templates used in categories|{{PAGENAME}}]] {{interwikitmp-grp |V=5{{#if:{{{1|}}}||{{{1}}}={{#if:{{{2|}}}||{{{2}}}=}}{{#if:{{{3|}}}||{{{3}}}=}}{{#if:{{{4|}}}||{{{4}}}=}}}} |inhib=yes |wqt=|wsr=|wdy=|mdw= |{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}}}}
;On {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Wpd|Wpd]]}} / {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Wbk|Wbk]]}} / {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Cms|Cms]]}} / {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Wdy|Wdy]]}} / {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Wqt|Wqt]]}} / {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Wsp|Wsp]]}} / {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Wsr|Wsr]]}} / {{[[{{{SISTER|}}}{{ns:Template}}:Wvy|Wvy]]}} (sister templates) *All such macro's enable calls from any sister project to use the same call and get the same output result. This feature is chiefly used in category pages being linked by the various interwiki category to category templates such as the paired tagging templates: [[w:Template:Commonscat1A|Commonscat1A]] & {{W2c|Template:Wikipediacat1A}} etcetera, including such for other sister projects like the omnibus template {{Tl|interwikicat-grp}} by simply copying the same language between the two matching categories. *Each connects to the general 'main' namespace of the given sister. Prefixing other namespaces such as ''Template: or Category:'', even talk spaces will link to such namespaces fine. In that case, the pipe-trick parameter {{{2}}} may be given to create a trimmer link of more pleasing appearance. *'Cms' is primarily useful for see also lists on en.wikipedia or other direct accessing needs into a commons page. (Talk to Talk page, for example). ;Notes on genesis and equivalence: :'W2' (ALSO:''' 'W' '''on many English sister projects, but with some name collisions on others) and 'W2c' interwiki templates came out of efforts to tag and interlink key categories on the Wikimedia Commons and En.Wikipedia, as the two places foreign language wiki's tie into and plant interwiki links. Mw (Meta) and Wd (Wiktionary) soon followed on the commons, wikpedia and Meta for inline referencing and direct page linking. All were written to enhance text portability when tagging and linking categories and then templates with common hyper linked prose to appropriate reference pages. :These four originals are ''now exist only 'as redirects' ''to the more mnemonic''' 'Wpd', 'Cms', 'Mta' and 'Wdy' '''respectively adopting the three letter near-mnemonic's of [[m:MP:TSP|Wikiproject template sharing project]], which is standardizing templates to enhance productivity on all the sister projects. :Some like the commons template {{[[Template:Cms|Cms]]}}, {{[[Template:Wbk|Wbk]]}}, {{[[Template:Wdy|Wdy]]}}, and {{[[Template:Wsp|Wsp]]}}, require logic to bypass their own prefix on their own site to enable interwiki portability or display of local links. (This is to say, that without such logic, these would display a full url, which does not reveal bad links, but full sitename prefixes are even worse, as evince always as redlinks).

It is thus far less costly of template pre-expansion and post expansion memory limits, making it more suitable for formatting in articles wherein a lot of templates are used pushing such limits. {{indent family usage}}

[[Category:Templates using ParserFunctions|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Category:Formatting templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
==Usage==
This template can be used inline to create alignment between adjacent text lines, or to space out titles, etc. Like {{tl|indent}}, it takes a numeric argument 'nn' after the pipe and provides that many consecutive spaces. Indent differs only in that it automatically begins a newline, then spaces over nn spaces.

==Example calls==
<nowiki>{{indent|2}}, {{space|7}}, etc. </nowiki>{{indent|5}}'''space''' and '''indent''' are limited to adding '''30 spaces'''.

==See also==
:'''{{tl|s}}''' — brief version for inline use, defaults to 3 spaces given no numeric argument.

</noinclude>

revision.comment: [[M:User:Addbot|Bot:]] Migrating 1 interwiki links, now provided by [[d:|Wikidata]] on [[d:q6185497]] [[M:User:Addbot/WDS|(translate me)]]
revision.text:
{{#if:{{{1|}}}|{{space|{{{1}}}}}|{{space|3}}}} IWTG-V: : Rev: P3-0 :2007-02-01.0 ;Changes: # Convert to parameter calls And use just a single template # subst calls {{Interwikitmp-grp|V=3 |ACAT=Typing-aid templates |EXCEPT= |cats= |wdy=SP |SPace{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}} }} ==Purpose/Usage== This is a short-form 'alias' for the template {{[[Template:space|space]]}}, which it calls, if necessary, with the default of '3', but will also accept a numeric argument and pass same onto space. *'space' is extremely useful to align things like 'monthname year' lists inside a table, but shoves the table innards around creating wrapped edit lines and disorganizing the columnar nature of such a flat table columnized list. :''''s'''', by defaulting to '3' ('NN') spaces thus takes up far less width and leaves the editor less confused by replacing either 'NN' ' ' and/or ' ' HTML codes or the 'space' template width itself allowing one to finesse things like lining up the years between a column of dates or other unequal length text fields, and other such naturally misaligning tabular data. ;for example:
{{space|5}}Heading one{{space|18}}Heading two:{{space|4}}{{indent|5}}November 2005 <----------->{{space|5}}November 2005{{indent|5}}May 2006{{space|5}} <----------->{{space|6}}May{{space|7}}2006...{{indent}}'''(all a one line entry, or can be spaced out some)''' gives:
{{space|5}}Heading one{{space|18}}Heading two:{{space|4}} {{indent|5}}November 2005 <----------->{{space|5}}November 2005{{indent|5}}May 2006{{space|5}} <----------->{{space|6}}May{{space|7}}2006 ;Note [[W:MSIE|MSIE]] technical limitations do not show the above columns properly aligned as do more advanced browsers. ==See also== {{indent|10}}See also {{tl|space}} & {{tl|indent}} and its shortform {{tl|I}}. All do not give an absolutely calculable display due to the working of wiki system display software, which abhors double whitespace and whitespace clarity, but are effective work-arounds once a text line length is established... which seem to be parsed for display back to front by wiki system software. [[Category:Formatting templates|S]]

;This template is part of wikiProject Template Sharing [[M:M:TSP|MP:TSP]]. It identifies common categories on the sister projects that hold templates or are used in the administration and tracking of such. :The categories this tags were carefully chosen by seeing the most prevalent names in use on the various sister projects during the Fall of '06. {{interwikitmp-grp |V=0 |SYS=yes|cat= |CATS=[[Category:Interwiki_category_linking_templates |{{PAGENAME}}]][[Category:Template documentation |{{PAGENAME}}]] }} {{-}}{{lts|interwikitmp-grp}} [[Category:Templates used in categories |{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Interwiki_category_linking_templates |!{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Interwiki template-links-tagging templates |!{{PAGENAME}}]] ==See also==

It is also aliased by the redirect [[template:TSP loose ends]] {{interwikitmp-grp|V=3 |wdy=|wqt=|wsr=|wmw= |inhib=yes |SYS=yes |cat=WikiProject template sharing loose ends |{{PAGENAME}} }} </noinclude>

commons::Note: Hidden content. ---- ;This is a register macro that might alternatively be stated as {{#ifeq:{{SITENAME}}|Wikimedia Commons|{{void}}|Commons:}} ---- This different method of implementation has instead a [[w:hardcode|hardcoded]] different fixed value on and off the commons when accessed by the identical template and so allows portable template coding such as that used in {{tlx|tlxc}}, uses of {{tlx|catlst}} and etc. ;This tempalate is a work around for the commons not having an abbreviation that will work on it's own pages. :The presence here is as an aid to identical tagging of categories with parent category quick links using {{tl|catlst}}. See [[w:category:Munich]], and [[{{CMS}}Category:Munich|the same on the commons]] where commons parent categories and wikipedia parent categories provide beneficial links to all. And the coding is that shown below: 

{{catlst|PRE='''|END='''|LABEL=Wikipedia Parent categories: 
|SISTER=W:| Cities in Bavaria | German state capitals}}

{{catlst|POST='''|END='''|LABEL=Commons Parent categories: 
|SISTER={{CMS}}|Municipalities in Bavaria | Upper Bavaria}}
*Used by: {{ltscms|Catlst}} for compatible tagging on and between sister projects, listing quick links to applicable main categories at the head of category pages. Such are way down and off (nearly) invisible on the default skin, especially in image categories on the commons, or long pages on the wikipedia's. {{Interwikitmp-grp|V=BOOL|cat=Interwikitmp-grp ineligible|I=cms| wbk=|wqt=|wsr=|cms}} [[Category:Boolean, register, and condition testing templates |{{PAGENAME}}]]

<includeonly>Wikispecies:</includeonly><noinclude>:Note: Hidden content.
---- ;This is a register macro that might alternatively be stated as <nowiki>{{#ifeq:{{SITENAME}}|Wikispecies|{{void}}|Wikispecies:}}</nowiki> ---- This different method of implementation has instead a [[w:hardcode|hardcoded]] different fixed value on and off Wikispecies when accessed by the identical template and so allows portable template coding such as that used in {{tlx|tlxc}}, uses of {{tlx|catlst}} and etc.
;This tempalate is a work around for the Wikispecies not having an abbreviation that will work on it's own pages.
{{Interwikitmp-grp|V=BOOL|cat=Interwikitmp-grp ineligible|I=wsp| wbk=|wqt=|wsr=}} [[Category:Boolean, register, and condition testing templates |{{PAGENAME}}]]
</noinclude>

;This is an [[W:Wikipedia:Template doc page pattern]] style documentation and utility page included by several templates: which are included in turn by many. By using such a second level of declaration pages, changes in an /doc style page do not get coupled to pages which use the higher level (many) templates, and so do not adversely affect or burden the database or the server loads. ---- {{interwikitmp-grp |V=D|cat=|inhib=yes |mdw=|wsr=|wqt= |SYS=yes|{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Templates used in categories |{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Interwiki_category_linking_templates |{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Interwiki template-links-tagging templates |{{PAGENAME}}]] {{interwikitmp-grp |V=2|inhib=yes |SYS=yes|cat= |mdw=|wsr=|wqt= |{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}}}} (Note: Active content is hidden) {{I2}} ;On this 'template': {{#ifeq:{{PAGENAME}}}|IWTG width|This page is a storage register '''value''' defining box width to allow resizing and shrinking of the link templates in the many {{lts|interwikitmp-grp}} tagged pages. * This parameter changes the width from the original default of 250px to a final value as yet to be determined. }} {{#ifeq:{{PAGENAME}}}|IWTG size|This page is a storage register '''value''' defining Image size to allow resizing and shrinking of the linking templates in the many {{lts|interwikitmp-grp}} tagged pages. This parameter changes the width from the original default of 35px to a final value as yet to be determined. }} {{#ifeq:{{PAGENAME}}|Interwiki class-sisterproject | ;Purpose: Sister-project templates ported from en.wp and the commons worked differently on some sister projects, because the local project apparently did or does not include the second 'class' code as part of their sister-project class in the [[Mediawiki:Common.css]] page. This template was originally written to supply the lack. Subsequently, it is being used to experimentally reduce these linking templates IN SIZE and space used as much as seems practicable and sensible. ==Usage== Replace the header line: '''
''' with the call to this template in the sister-project linking template with the below line: 
{{Interwiki class-sisterproject|
}}
|This parameter directly affects the size of the [[W:Wikipedia:Sister projects|many sister projects]] templates in the arrays on pages tagged with one of the XXXXXtmp and XXXXXcat1 and XXXXXcat1A individual tagging templates (as well as some variations) — the latter 'cat' suffixed templates connect sister project to sister project on category namespace pages to form a navigation link highway for the customer users, the former 'tmp' suffixed templates connect template space to template space, normally to another template of the same name, but are in general depreciated in favor of {{tl|interwikitmp-grp}}, save when template variety affects or can be used only by two or a few sister projects.
* It's actual manifestation is by inclusion via {{lts|Interwiki class-sisterproject}} which does some other size adjustments from the css 'class-sisterproject' defaults common to this type of template. * It is setting up these dynamic size parameters that make it desirable to have this as a variable of sorts independent of coding in Interwiki class-sisterproject. }} ;Related Templates using this page: # {{lts|IWTG size}} # {{lts|IWTG width}} # {{lts|interwiki class-sisterproject}}

250px ;Note page has hidden operative code when viewed directly. {| style="font-size:80%; background:#f9f9f9; border:#aaa 1px solid; font-face:monotype; width: 90%; margin: 0 auto 1em auto;" |-bgcolor="#cedff2" align-text="center" !colspan=4 |

Example: :{{Lcs|Interwiki utility templates}} appears as: :{{Lcs|Interwiki utility templates}} == Documentation == [[Template:Lcs}} is a smaller variant of [[Template:Lc|Lc]] with pleasant output also on browsers which don't support [[interpunct|·]]. [[Template:Lcs|Lcs]] allows one parameter, the name of an existing [[Wikipedia:Category|Category]]. It can be used on talk and user pages related to an existing [[WP:TPG|talk page]] of the category, but the linked category talk page might also not yet exist. === Usage === {{Lcs|category}} shows links for the specified category
{{Lcs}} shows links for a category wrt the {{PAGENAME}} === Example === {| | '''Code''' || '''Result''' |- | {{Lcs|Interwiki utility templates}} | {{Lcs|Interwiki utility templates}} |- | {{Lcs}} | {{Lcs}} |} ''The latter shows bogus links, as long as no category'' {{PAGENAME}} ''exists.'' === See also === * {{Lts|Lcs}} for Categories * {{Lts|Lps}} for {{ns:Project}} * {{Lts|Lts}} for Templates * {{Lcs|Internal link templates}} === Comparison === We got a zoo of similar templates, pick what you like. This list is probably incomplete and intentionally omits redirections: {| | '''Source''' || '''Code''' || '''Result''' |- | {{Lts/|cl}} | {{cl|Interwiki utility templates}} | {{cl|Interwiki utility templates}} |- | {{Lts/|ccl}} | {{ccl|Interwiki utility templates}} | {{ccl|Interwiki utility templates}} |- | {{Lts/|lc}} | {{lc|Interwiki utility templates}} | {{lc|Interwiki utility templates}} |- | {{Lts/|lcs}} | {{lcs|Interwiki utility templates}} | {{lcs|Interwiki utility templates}} |}{{-}} [[Category:Internal link templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.text: {{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} {{[[template:TOCright|TOCright]]}} This template forces the auto-generated Table of Contents for an article to appear in a table that is floated to the right side of the page, in order to improve article layout. == Usage == Insert {{TOCright}} at the point in the article where you want the top of the Table of Contents box to appear. It should only be used in cases where the TOC gets in the way of other content or is detrimental to the layout of the page; it should ''not'' simply be used for aesthetics since it tampers with the standard appearance of articles. See [[Wikipedia:Section#Floating the TOC]] for further guidelines. == Example == {{TOCright}} look to the right → ==See Also== * {{Lts}} * {{Lts|TOCleft}} * [[Help:Magic words#Table_of_contents|Help:Magic words]] [[Òtù:Templates]] [[Category:TOC templates]]

revision.text: {{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} {{TOCleft}} == Purpose == {{tl|{{BASEPAGENAME}}}} forces the auto-generated Table of Contents for an article to appear in a table that is floated to the left side of the page (as seen left), in order to improve article layout. == Usage == Insert {{TOCleft}} at the point in the article where you want the top of the Table of Contents box to appear. Use with {{tl|-}}, {{tl|clearleft}}, or {{tl|clearright}} to prevent images coalitions. == Cautions == Do not use this template to just force word warp around the TOC, as this is inappropriate method of achieving this. Instead add a CSS class to your monobook.css file which will apply site wide. This template should not be used when the result is to place the TOC in a visually poor location. A TOC that crosses a section division is probably a poor idea, if that can be avoided. Unless the section in which the {{tl|TOCleft}} is placed is long enough, the result may well be undesirable. Note particularly that if the TOC is floated left of a bulleted list, the bullets will be hidden. It should only be used in cases where the TOC gets in the way of other content or is detrimental to the layout of the page; it should ''not'' simply be used for aesthetics since it tampers with the standard appearance of articles. See [[Help:Section#Floating the TOC]] for further guidelines. ==See Also== * {{Lts|TOCright}} [[Òtù:Templates]] [[Category:TOC templates]]

{{#if:{{{1|}}}|{{Space|{{{1}}}}}|{{Space|3}}}}<noinclude> ;This is template ''''s'''' or ''''S'''' on the below sisterwiki's, which also have a copy of this 'SP', for interwiki portability needs:
{{Interwikitmp-grp0|!SP|SP}} <!-- '0' as is integral to porting documentation --->
==Purpose/Usage==
This is a short-form 'alias' for the template {{TL|Space}}, which it calls, if necessary, with the default of '3', but will also accept a numeric argument and pass same onto Space.
*'Space' is extremely useful to align things like 'monthname year' lists inside a table, but shoves the table innards around creating wrapped edit lines and disorganizing the columnar nature of such a flat table columnized list.
:''''s'''' on other sisters, '''SP''' ([[computer science]] [[ASCII]] abbreviation) here due to template collisions and prior use.{{i| |2}}'''SP''' will default to '3' ('NN') spaces thus takes up far less width and leaves the editor less confused by replacing either 'NN' '<nowiki>& nbsp ;</nowiki>' and/or '<nowiki>& emsp ;</nowiki>' HTML codes or the 'space' template width itself allowing one to finesse things like lining up the years between a column of dates or other unequal length text fields, and other such naturally misaligning tabular data.
[[Category:Interwiki utility templates|!{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Typing-aid templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] </noinclude>

'''Ver: Pass 3A''' -- revising to use perameters for categorization, with aim of eliminating all IWTG-NN suffixed pages. This '0' version used as testbed and will supplant {{TL|interwikitmp-grp}} entirely sometime in the near future. Pedia Version 3A begins. Edits of changes began last evening. [ Comparison this to Interwikitmp-grp] meta 2F commons, 2Fa books, 2Fb, 06:44, 28 January 2007 (UTC), 2Fg update, 08:33, 28 January 2007 (UTC) species, 2Fc, 07:15, 28 January 2007 (UTC) + 08:05, 28 January 2007 (UTC) versity, 2Fd, 2Ff 07:43, 28 January 2007 (UTC) http://en.wikiversity.org/w/index.php?title=Species:Template:Interwikitmp-grp&action=edit '''trying to go to Wikispecies from versity''' source, 2Fe, 07:59, 28 January 2007 (UTC) http://en.wikisource.org/w/index.php?title=Species:Template:Interwikitmp-grp&action=edit '''trying to go to Wikispecies from source''' quote, 2Fg, 08:22, 28 January 2007 (UTC) http://en.wikiquote.org/w/index.php?title=Species:Template:Interwikitmp-grp&action=edit, '''trying to go to Wikispecies from source''' Versity3, 2Fg, 08:23, 28 January 2007 (UTC) WikiPedia2, 2Fg, 08:41, 28 January 2007 (UTC) Wikimedia Commons, 2F-h, 16:34, 30 January 2007 (UTC) WikiPedia3 2F-k, 15:42, 31 January 2007 (UTC)

It's going to get far harder as time as more goes out. ::* Hmmmm, can a BOT do a list and remove or add OVR=xxx| segments within a line? Seems likely.

|ACAT=Typing-aid templates
|EXCEPT=
|cats=
|wdy=SP
|SPace{{PAGENAME}}|{{PAGENAME}}
}}

This project under construction ...
Pardon our appearance whist we remodel,
pull the engine, and change the tires.
==Usage== This template can be used when more than one English language sister projects has a similar template. If the templates have different names on different projects you can use parameters to specify those names: *'''mta'''=template name at Meta-wiki *'''wpd'''=template name at English Wikipedia *'''cms'''=template name at Commons *'''wbk'''=template name at English Wikibooks *'''wqt'''=template name at English Wikiquote *'''wsr'''=template name at English Wikisource *'''wdy'''=template name at English Wikitionary *'''wnw'''=template name at English Wikinews *'''wsp'''=template name at English Wikispecies *'''wvr'''=template name at English Wikiversity *'''mdw'''=template name at Media-wiki 
Passing an empty parameter will cause the item to be omitted from the list.

Example:

{{Template:Interwikitmp-grp
|meta=
|wq=
|wn=foo
}}

This produces a box with the Meta and Wikiquote rows ommitted, and the "Template:foo" linked to in the Wikinews row.

:''This Interwikitmp-grp (family of) templates documentation is [[Wikipedia:Template doc page pattern| transcluded]] from [[w:Template:Interwikitmp-grp/doc]]'' [[{{fullurl:Template:Interwikitmp-grp/doc|action=edit}} edit local page]]. [[Category:Interwiki_template_linking_templates |{{PAGENAME}}]] ==General usage== :This is usage for the nine+ 'interwiki template linking' and the various (8) interwikitmp-grpX 'auto-categorization' and template tagging and linking utilities. # Each individual sister template ends with the suffix 'tmp' and start with the menemonic name of the sister, sometimes in abbreviated or [[CamelCase]] text form. (e.g. WikiPtmp, WikiNews, WikiSpecies are all CamelBack, whilst WikiPtmp is also an abbreviation. # Each of the interwikitmp-grpX templates differ mainly in the categorization they perform and slight differences in usage text they present (interwikitmp-grpD, where 'D' is for documentation). # Each number suffixed version differs in the mix of categories which they autotag for uniform categorization across the English language sister projects. This aids people by having common tools in common places that perform the same common way. # Foreign language adaptations of this system are encouraged, but beyond the scope of this project. Copy the pages, and translate the usage, and you should be in good shape. {{Interwikitmp-grp|V=D|SYS=yes|inhib=yes}} ---- Other [[Wikipedia:Sister projects|sister projects]] links using this system of tagging (The array below is produced by this page): [[Category:Interwiki link templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Interwiki templates on all sisterprojects|{{PAGENAME}}]] {{Interwikitmp-grps see also}}

[[[[{{SITENAME}}:Categorization|Category]]:[[:Category:{{{1}}}|{{{1}}}]]]] ---- {{#ifeq:Wikipedia|{{SITENAME}}|This [[Wikipedia:Template|template]] is a [[Wikipedia:Avoid self-references|self-reference]] and so is part of the Wikipedia project rather than the encyclopaedic content.}} ==See also these category utilities== * {{tlw|c}}   -- pipetricked category name -- skips 'Category:' and displays bare link. * {{tlw|cat}}/{{tlw|CAT}} -- Same as {{tlw|C}}, but expresses 'Category:' as part of the link. * {{tlw|cl}}  -- compromise macro between 'C' and 'Cat': [[:Category:{{{1}}}|Cat:{{{1}}}]] * {{tlw|lc}}  -- Category name and full links -- for administration and discussion pages * {{tlw|lcs}} -- Category name and '''s'''maller set of links -- same purposes,
but note, both are useful from within preview screens as well to explore and study relationships, or make related changes. * {{tlw|cat see also}} -list of many, fixed output format * {{tlw|catlst}} -- list of many and more, flexible output format, greater capacity. Interwiki capable of linking to sister projects. [[Category:Internal link templates|Cl]] [[Category:Typing-aid templates|Cl]]

Hence the name, 'Tlw' is an [[Wikt:mnemonic|mnemonic]] [[W:initialism|initialism]] for ''''T'''emplate '''l'''ist (on) '''W'''ikipedia'. ;Related: * [[W:template:template list]] {{#ifeq:{{SITENAME}}|Wikipedia|
— (locally {{lts|template list}})}} -- which takes the parameter ''''|SISTER='''' to designate non-local template space, and allows list of links examination of upto forty templates locally (default) or across the interwiki divide. * Tlx, which provides not only a better presentation than {{tl|tl}}, but the same SISTER= parameter capability. Giving rise to the front end templates: : '''{{tlw|Tlxc}}, {{tlw|Tlxm}},''' and '''{{tlw|Tlxw}}''' which with a one letter change link to a template on the Commons, Meta, and Wikipedia respectively.

It's used for templates often copied from Meta to other sister projects, or vice versa. In general is a means of checking interwiki on the key perameters that may be affected by a change in the template page where used (i.e. '{PAGENMAME}' is default), or which is specified by the first argument, if given one. {{Lts/Doc|2}} [[Category:Interwiki link templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.text:
This template displays a "Template documentation" box like you are seeing now.
It is primarily used by {{tl|template doc}} to automatically display the documentation for the template from a /doc subpage, but can also be used to display inline documentation.
==Usage== '''{{tlx|template doc inline|1=''inline documentation''|2=''pagename''}}'''
* ''Inline documentation'' is the text to display inside the box. * ''Pagename'' refers to the name of the documentation page, which if specified, creates [view] and [edit] boxes to the right of the heading.

This template displays a "Template documentation" box just like you are seeing now. == Usage == # Add <noinclude>{{template doc}}</noinclude> to the main template. # Click the "edit" link, which points to the /doc subpage, and write documentation there. # Add categories and interwiki links to the /doc subpage inside <includeonly></includeonly>. == Limitation == A pipe character in the documentation page which is not inside double or triple braces or double brackets disturbs proper functioning of this template, because the content of that page is assigned to a template parameter. Use | instead. == See also == * [[Template:Template doc inline]] [[ro:Format:Template doc/doc]] [[zh:Template:模板文件/doc]] [[zh:Template:模板文件]]

{{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} ==Documentation== This is an auxiliary template allowing to encode "|" within template parameters. It is necessary if the character is used in wiki table syntax. In other cases it is better to use "|". This template cannot be used for putting the character as text in a wiki table; in that case, again, "|" can be used. See also: *{{tim|!}} *[[:en:WP:QIF]] Note that no special template is needed for "!" (exclamation mark). This is a '''high risk template''', and it cannot be [[:en:WP:SUBST|substituted]]. {{Lts|{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Template namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[ab:Ашаблон:!]] [[ace:Pola:!]] <noinclude>==Template content== </noinclude><!-- Template:Subst start -->When using [[Wikipedia:Template substitution|certain template tags]] on talk pages, don't forget to [[Wikipedia:Template substitution|substitute with text]] by adding '''subst:''' to the template tag. For example, use {{subst:uw-test1}} instead of {{uw-test1}}. This reduces server load and prevents accidental blanking of the template. <!-- Template:Subst end --> <noinclude> ==Usage== This template consists of the above text, and is effectively just a message about using "subst:", mainly used on other template pages. It should probably not be "subst"ed, as the wording or advice may change.
[[Category:User warning templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] </noinclude>

<includeonly>{{template doc page transcluded}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{template doc page viewed directly}}</noinclude> <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE --> == Usage == This template produces a link to a list of map sources, based on the geographical coordinates and other parameters, concatenated into one template parameter. The other template parameter is the link label.
Use: :<tt><nowiki>{{coor|cc|tt}}</nowiki></tt>
Where: * ''cc'' is the coordinate written in the format required by the [[Special:Mapsources]] page. For example, for the coordinate '''59° 55′ N 10° 44′ E''', use: <tt>'''59_55_N_10_44_E'''</tt>. * ''tt'' is the text appearing in the link
For more parameters (scale, location type, etc.) see [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates#Implementation details]].
The main coordinates templates (see below) are generally used instead of this template.
== See also == On how to use the different templates, see [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style (dates and numbers)#Geographical coordinates]]
For further information, see [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates|WikiProject Geographical coordinates]].
*[[Template:oscoor]] for coordinates using the [[British national grid reference system]]. *German version of the template: [[:de:Vorlage:Koordinate]] *Danish version of the template: [[:da:Skabelon:Coor_dms]]
===Main coordinates templates=== *{{main coordinates templates}}
<includeonly> <!-- ADD CATEGORIES BELOW THIS LINE --> [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: New page: <includeonly>{{template doc page transcluded}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{template doc page viewed directly}}</noinclude> This template creates a link to a list of map sources. It is t...
revision.text:
{{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} This template creates a link to a list of map sources. It is the same as [[Template:coor]] but uses a UK [[British national grid reference system|Ordnance Survey grid reference]] as the coordinates. === Warning === This is an experimental facility. By all means use it, but to avoid problems when things change: * definitely do not create any links to the external URL which this template calls * do not use this template directly in any article * instead use one of the templates which use this one. Or create a new template. == Usage == Use: :'''{{oscoor|cc|tt}}''' Where: * '''cc''' is the grid reference in one of the formats listed below followed, optionally, by any [[Wikipedia:WikiProject_Geographical_coordinates#Parameters|additional parameters]]. For example: TQ123456_region:GB_scale:25000 * '''tt''' is the text to appear in the link. Grid reference formats - letters are not case-sensitive: {| cellspacing=0 border=1 cellpadding=2 |- |   || [[British national grid reference system|Great Britain]] |- | 888_999 || Two decimal numbers - eastings then northings in metres
separated by an underscore (for consistency with {{coor}})
Eg.: {{oscoor|439668_1175316_region:GB|439668_1175316}} |- | SE || rowspan=5 | Standard grid references.
In each of these cases, the actual coordinates passed to the map sources page will be the centre of the square that the grid ref defines |- | SE16 |- | SE1267 |- | SE123678 |- | SE12346789 |- | SE1234567890 || Full "ten figure" grid reference |- | |- |   || [[Irish national grid reference system|Ireland]] - proposed - not yet implemented |- | i888_999 || Letter 'i' followed by two decimal numbers - eastings then northings in metres
separated by an underscore |- | R || rowspan=5 | Standard grid references.
In each of these cases, the actual coordinates passed to the map sources page will be the centre of the square that the grid ref defines |- | R16 |- | R1267 |- | R123678 |- | R12346789 |- | R1234567890 || Full "ten figure" grid reference |} == See also == For further information, see [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates|WikiProject Geographical coordinates]]. For more UK mapping templates, see [[Template:Gbmapping]] ([[Template talk:Gbmapping|talk]]). [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:External link templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[sv:mall:oscoor]]

{{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} This template produces a link to a list of map sources, based on the geographical coordinates and other parameters, and provides a standardized notation for the coordinates. The template is for geographical [[latitude]] and [[longitude]] coordinates on [[Earth]], expressed in degrees, minutes and seconds. See [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates]] for further information. == Usage == See [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style %28dates and numbers%29#Geographical coordinates]]. Quick format reference: : {{coor dms|''DD''|''MM''|''SS''|''N/S''|''DD''|''MM''|''SS''|''E/W''|}} ==See also== *{{main coordinates templates}} [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[fi:Malline:Coor d]] [[ta:வார்ப்புரு:Coor d]]

{{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} This template produces a link to a list of map sources, based on the geographical coordinates and other parameters, and provides a standardized notation for the coordinates. The template is for geographical [[latitude]] and [[longitude]] coordinates on [[Earth]], expressed in degrees, minutes and seconds. See [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates]] for further information. == Usage == See [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style %28dates and numbers%29#Geographical coordinates]]. Quick format reference: : {{coor dms|''DD''|''MM''|''SS''|''N/S''|''DD''|''MM''|''SS''|''E/W''|}} ==See also== *{{main coordinates templates}} [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[als:Vorlage:Coor dms]] [[bg:Шаблон:Coor dms]] [[br:Patrom:Dave douar.]] [[ca:Plantilla:Coor dms]] [[da:Skabelon:Coor dms]] [[eo:Ŝablono:Coor dms]] [[es:plantilla:Coor dms]] [[fi:Malline:Coor dms]] [[fo:Fyrimynd:Coor dms]] [[hi:Template:Coor dms]] [[hr:Predložak:Coor dms]] [[hu:Sablon:Coor dms]] [[id:Templat:Coor dms]] [[is:Snið:Coor dms]] [[ka:თარგი:Coor dms]] [[kk:Template:Coor dms]] [[kn:Template:Coor dms]] [[la:Formula:Coor dms]] [[lb:Template:Coor dms]] [[lt:Šablonas:Coor dms]] [[mk:Шаблон:Coor dms]] [[nl:sjabloon:Coor dms]] [[nn:Mal:Coor dms]] [[pt:Predefinição:Coor dms]] [[ro:Format:Coor dms]] [[sh:Template:Coor dms]] [[sk:Šablóna:Coor dms]] [[sl:Predloga:Coor dms]] [[sq:Stampa:Coor dms]] [[tl:Template:Coor dms]] [[vi:Tiêu bản:Coor dms]] [[zh:Template:Coor dms]]

{{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} This template places the coordinates in the upper-right of the article, just below the horizontal rule running under the article's title. ==Usage== The template should be placed at the '''bottom of the article''' before the Categories and interwiki language links, so that other editors will always know where to find it. Furthermore, future implementations may treat it differently in different site themes, and placing it in a standard location will make this easier. Copy this blank version to use: 
{{coor title d|deg|NS|deg|EW|optional}}
Replace the first occurrence of ''deg'' with the degree of the North-South component of the coordinates, and the second occurrences with the same for the East-West component. ''NS'' and ''EW'' should each be replaced with one or the other of ''N'' or ''S'', and ''E'' or ''W''. The ''optional'' can be any type:, region:, or scale: parameters that are recognised by the map server (such as the popular type:city and type:landmark options. See [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates#Parameters]] for a comprehensive list). ==See also== *{{main coordinates templates}} [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Title templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[gl:Modelo:Coordenadas]] [[ia:Patrono:Coor title d]] [[ja:Template:Coor title d]] [[mk:Шаблон:Координати-наслов d]] [[ml:ഫലകം:Coor title d]] [[mwl:Modelo:Geocordenadas]] [[pa:ਫਰਮਾ:ਥਾਂ]] [[pt:Predefinição:Geocoordenadas]] [[simple:Template:Coor title d]] [[sq:Stampa:Koordinata]] [[sr:Шаблон:Коор наслов]] [[su:Citakan:Coor title d]] [[ta:வார்ப்புரு:Coor title d]] [[tr:Şablon:Koordinat]] [[vo:Samafomot:Coor title d]] [[ast:Plantía:Coordenaes]] [[az:Şablon:Koordinat]] [[bg:Шаблон:Coor title d]] [[ca:Plantilla:Coor title d]] [[cs:Šablona:Geo]] [[eo:Ŝablono:Artikolo kun koordinatoj]] [[fi:Malline:Coor title d]]
[[Geographic coordinate system|Coordinates]]: {{coor dm|{{{1}}}|{{{2}}}|{{{3}}}|{{{4}}}|{{{5}}}|{{{6}}}|{{{7}}}}} {{{{FULLPAGENAME}}/doc}}

revision.text:
{{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} This template places the coordinates in the upper-right of the article, just below the horizontal rule running under the article's title. ==Usage== The template should be placed at the '''bottom of the article''' before the Categories and interwiki language links, so that other editors will always know where to find it. Furthermore, future implementations may treat it differently in different site themes, and placing it in a standard location will make this easier. Copy this blank version to use: 
{{coor title dm|deg|min|NS|deg|min|EW|optional}}
Replace the first occurrences of ''deg'', and ''min'' with the degree, minute, and second of the North-South component of the coordinates, and the second occurrences with the same for the East-West component. ''NS'' and ''EW'' should each be replaced with one or the other of ''N'' or ''S'', and ''E'' or ''W''. The ''optional'' can be any type:, region:, or scale: parameters that are recognised by the map server (such as the popular type:city and type:landmark options. See [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates#Parameters]] for a comprehensive list). ==See also== *{{main coordinates templates}} [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Title templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Geographic coordinate system|Coordinates]]: {{coor dms|{{{1}}}|{{{2}}}|{{{3}}}|{{{4}}}|{{{5}}}|{{{6}}}|{{{7}}}|{{{8}}}|{{{9}}}}} {{{{FULLPAGENAME}}/doc}}

{{template doc page transcluded}}{{template doc page viewed directly}} __NOTOC__ == Usage == The template should be placed at the '''bottom of the article''' before the Categories and interwiki language links, so that other editors will always know where to find it. Furthermore, future implementations may treat it differently in different site themes, and placing it in a standard location will make this easier. Copy this blank version to use: 
{{coor title dms|deg|min|sec|NS|deg|min|sec|EW|optional}}
Replace the first occurrences of ''deg'', ''min'', and ''sec'' with the degree, minute, and second of the North-South component of the coordinates, and the second occurrences with the same for the East-West component. ''NS'' and ''EW'' should each be replaced with one or the other of ''N'' or ''S'', and ''E'' or ''W''. The ''optional'' can be any type:, region:, or scale: parameters that are recognised by the map server (such as the popular type:city and type:landmark options. See [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Geographical coordinates#Parameters]] for a comprehensive list). == Purpose == This template places latitude and longitude coordinates for the location somewhere near the article's title, depending on the skin used and whether a user is logged in. Clicking on the coordinates will take users to an experimental mapsource wiki where they can choose a particular map site to view that location. == Other templates in this family == *{{[[Template:coor title d|coor title d]]}} *{{[[Template:coor title dm|coor title dm]]}} ==See also== *{{main coordinates templates}} [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Title templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[ca:Plantilla:Coor title dms]] [[es:Plantilla:Coor title dms]] [[fi:Malline:Coor title dms]] [[fr:Modèle:Coordonnées]] [[hi:साँचा:Coor title dms]] [[ia:Patrono:Coor title dms]] [[kk:Үлгі:Coor title dms]] [[mk:Шаблон:Координати-наслов dms]] [[nl:Sjabloon:Coor title dms]] [[sa:फलकम्:Coor title dms]] [[simple:Template:Coor title dms]] [[sl:Predloga:Koordinate DMS v naslovu]] [[su:Citakan:Coor title dms]] [[tg:Шаблон:Coor title dms]] [[vo:Samafomot:Coor title dms]]

<includeonly>{{template doc page transcluded}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{template doc page viewed directly}}</noinclude> <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE --> This template combines: *[[Template:Coor dm]] *[[Template:Coor title dm]]
It lists the coordinates within the article text and at the upper-right corner of the article, just below the horizontal rule running under the article's title (in Monobook, placement in other skins varies).
==See also== *{{main coordinates templates}}
<includeonly> <!-- ADD CATEGORIES BELOW THIS LINE --> [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Title templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
<!-- ADD INTERWIKIS BELOW THIS LINE --> [[zh-yue:Template:座標]]
</includeonly>

<includeonly>{{template doc page transcluded}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{template doc page viewed directly}}</noinclude> <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE --> This template combines: *[[Template:Coor dms]] *[[Template:Coor title dms]]
It lists the coordinates within the article text and at the upper-right corner of the article, just below the horizontal rule running under the article's title (in Monobook, placement in other skins varies).
==See also== *{{main coordinates templates}}
<includeonly> <!-- ADD CATEGORIES BELOW THIS LINE --> [[Category:Coordinates templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Title templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
<!-- ADD INTERWIKIS BELOW THIS LINE -->
</includeonly>

Wikipedia templates that place content in the top of an article, above or just below the line under an article's title in monobook skin (placement in other skins may vary). See above example.
Example of content in title area.
[[Òtù:Templates]]

revision.comment: /* Lee nke ozo */clean up, replaced: {{-stub}} → {{ÉdéNtạ}} using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
[[Usòrò:Locator Map Aba-Nigeria.png|thumb|Ebe Aba no na Naigeria]] [[Usòrò:Aba Nigeria hotel.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Aba]] '''Abá''' bu [[ama ukwu]] nọ na ebe nleda anyanwu [[Naigeria]]. Ono n'ime [[Nkeji Ochíchí wų Abia]]. Aba nwèrè oshimiri nke ha kpòrò ''Aba''. Otu oke ndi Igbo, ndi nke ana-kpo ndi ''[[Ngwa]]'' bi n'Aba na nnukwu.
Njirimara Aba ǫzǫ bų izų ahia. A na azų ahia ǫfuma n'Aba. Ahia ama ǫfųma dį na ala a bų a) Ahia Ariaria - a na ere igbe, akwa ǫhųrų, ihe ųlǫ na ihe ndi ǫzǫ b) Ahia ǫhųrų - a na ere ihe eji esi nni, akwa ochie c) Ahia cemeteri - a na ere ihe nni ebe o dį ukwuu
==Lee nke ozo== * [[Abia State]] * [[Umuahia]]
{{ÉdéNtạ}}
[[Òtù:Ama ukwu no na Naigeria]]

class="messagebox" style="{{#if:{{{small|}}} |width:62.5%; float:left; padding:0.25em; |width:80%; align:center; float:center; padding:1em;}} background:#e0f0f9; margin:0.5em; color:black;">
[[Image:Category.svg|270px|right|Union]]
This is a "'''tracking category'''", a category intended to build and maintain a list of pages primarily for the sake of the list itself. {{#if:{{{redirect category|}}}{{{redirect|}}} |

This tracking category that maintains a list of redirect pages. See {{wpd|:Category:Redirects}}, {{wpd|Wikipedia:Redirects}} and {{wpd|Wikipedia:Template messages/Redirect pages}} for further information.| Rather than being part of the encyclopedia's categorization scheme, these categories are used to track, for example, the use of syntaxes that may be deprecated in the future, to maintain a list of pages that may need to be edited ''en masse'' later, or to aggregate the members of several sub-categories by other classifications into one larger list. {{#ifeq:{{SITENAME}}|Wikipedia |

Some maintenance lists need to be checked periodically for backlogs, such as {{c|Categories for discussion notices}} and other ''X''fD administrative tracking categories.|
}}}}{{{1|}}}{{{ALTTEXT|}}} {{#if:{{{help|}}}{{{2|}}} |{{{2|
{{{help{{{2|}}}}}}
|
Items are added to this category by including the command [[Category:{{PAGENAME}}]] to the bottom of the page you wish to categorize.}}}}} {{#if:{{{inhibit|}}}{{{inhib|}}} | |[[Category:Tracking categories]] }}{{{CATS|}}} [[Category:category namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tracking categories|}{{PAGENAME}} ]] [[Category:Templates used in categories|{{PAGENAME}}]] {{Interwikitmp-grp|inhib=1|V=3|cat=category namespace templates|!{{PAGENAME}}}} ;Parameters 'ALTTEXT', 'CATS', {{{redirect category|}}} or {{{redirect|}}}, et. al.: :1. This template (originally) includes the head-end (includeonly) part of [[:Category:Tracking categories]] with a more normal application name, and takes a parameter 'ALTTEXT' which is inserted after that templates simple message for purpose and such. It places both in an attractive blue box. (above){{2}} :2. It also auto-categorizes to [[Category:Tracking categories]] and any categories specified by the parameter 'CATS=', which data need be full wiki-links with pipe-tricks.{{2}} :3. Parameter 'redirect' or 'redirect category' truncates the lead in message and customizes the message displayed for redirects categories.{{2}} :4. Parameter 'inhibit', when defined to anything, suppresses auto-categorization of the page to the [[:Category:Tracking categories]]. This is for self use on that category, and for cases when there are sub-categories under a common sub-category of Tracking categories. {{I2}}An 'inhibit' example: {{I5}}''Categories for discussion'' has the sub-categories 'for merging', 'for renaming', and 'for deletion', all as sub-cats. So 'Inhibit' is used in those so they cat as sub-categories of 'for discussion', not of 'Tracking Categories' which already contains 'for discussion'.

[http://translatewiki.net Tuwaria asụsụ] maka asụsụ Igbo; rụwa na élú Njikotá edemede gi!'''

Isị ya bu [[Umuahia]], tomadi [[Aba]] bu ebe ahia ukwu ya no. Abia State nola n'afo [[Imo State]] ru [[1991]], mgbe ndi government coro ya guzie ya state. [[Ndi Igbo]] bi na ya na nke ukwu. Oche nke enweghi aka, n'azu, bu nke ana-kpo ''stool''. Mgbe ochee vuru ivu, nwe ''padding'', ana-kpo ya ''couch'' na ''sofa'' ufodu. Mgbe o nweghi padding, onwere aka, o-nweghi, ana-kpo ya ''bench''.

Olusegun Obasanjo
[[Usòrò:Images-Obasanjo-Images10.jpg]]
12th [[President of Nigeria]]
'''In office'''
[[29 Mee]], [[1999]] – [[29 Mee]], [[2007]]
Vice President(s) [[Atiku Abubakar]]
Preceded by [[Abdulsalami Abubakar]]
Succeeded by [[Umaru Yar'Adua]]
Born [[03 Mee]], [[1937]]
[[Abeokuta]], [[Ogun State]], [[Nigeria]]
Political party [[People's Democratic Party]]
Spouse Lynda Obasanjo (ex-wife, deceased), [[Stella Obasanjo]] (deceased)
Religion [[Christianity]]
'''Olusegun Obasanjo''' bula onye president Naigeria, soto [[Abdulsalami Abubakar]]. Obu ya bu onye ndi madu mere elect mgbe Abdulsalami mere vote. ==Akuko ya== Olusegun bu onye Yoruba. A muru ya na 5 Maachị 1937, ebe Abeokuta, Ogun State. O tinyere ishi na Army la 1958 ha me ''head of state''. ==Lee nke özö== * [[Atiku Abubakar]] * [[Sani Abacha]] [[Òtù:President of Naigeria]]

General Sani Abacha
[[Usòrò:Sabacha.jpg]]
----
10th [[President of Nigeria]]
'''In office'''
[[17 Novemba]], [[1993]] – [[8 Juun]], [[1998]]
Preceded by [[Ernest Shonekan]]
Succeeded by [[Abdulsalami Abubakar]]
Born [[20 Septemba]], [[1943]]
[[Kano State]], [[Nigeria]]
Political party none (military)
Religion [[Islam]]
'''Sani Abacha bula''' onye eze Nigeria, 1993-1998. Amuru ya 20 Septemba 1943 na Kano. O mere ndi Army Nigeria wefu ndi mmadu na government Nigerian, otu ya kawa he ndi mmadu gi me. Ha wuru 8 Juun 1998. ==Lee nke ozo== * [[Ernest Shonekan]] * [[Olusegun Obasanjo]] [[Òtù:President of Naigeria]]

revision.text:
'''Administrators''', onye ana-kpo '''admins''' na '''sysops''', bu '''[[Wikipedia:Nde-ukwu|nde-ukwu]]''', nde di lekota Wikipedia. Obu nwe di lekota website nke ya ne me k'oma. Onye choro ibu '''admin''' kwesiri me ka nde [[Wikipedia:Requests for Adminship|community]] mara. Onye ahu kwesiri ''nwe he oma omere'' na Wikipedia.
'''Administrators''', called also '''admins''' and '''sysops''', are the people who take care of Wikipedia. They are the ones who maintain this site so that it does well. Whoever wants to be an '''admin''' should let the [[Wikipedia:Requests for Adminship|community]] know. They ''should have good contributions'' they have made to Wikipedia.
== Le kwa == * [[Wikipedia:Requests for Adminship|Ebee ana-juo e mee gi nde-ukwu]] [[Òtù:Wikipedia]]

revision.comment: [[User:addbot|Bot]]: Migrating interwiki links, now provided by [[d:|Wikidata]] on [[d:q4048254]]
revision.text:
{{Template:RfA_evu_vo}} Page nkena bu nga onye choro ibu '''[[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrator]]''' kwesiri tinye aha ya. Onye ahu kwesiri ma otu agee mee ya ([[{{FULLPAGENAME}}/nominate|guo ya!]]). Madu nwere ike nominate onye Wikipedia ochoro (onye i nominate-iri kwesiri kwe). Anyi nile voteye mana onye nominee kwesiri bu admin. Onye ahu nwetee vote, o kwesiri tinye aha ya la '''[[m:Requests for Permissions]]''' page ta '''nde-ukwu ozo''' ma, mee ya administrator. This page is where any Igbo Wikipedia user who wants to be an '''[[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrator]]''' should put their name. If you want to apply you should know the rules and the guidelines ([[{{FULLPAGENAME}}/nominate|read it!]]). You can also nominate someone else to be an admin (the person nominated should agree beforehand). Other users should then vote on whether or not they agree for the nominee to become an admin. If he or she receives the supporting vote then he or she should then put their name in the '''[[m:Requests for Permissions]]''' page so that '''other higher admins''' (called [[Wikipedia:Stewards|stewards]]) can know and make them an administrator. ==Mgbe igi vote== '''Nwere otu picture nkee tinye vote gi''' (''use one of these pictures to vote''): [[Image:Symbol_support_vote.svg|16px]] [[Image:Symbol_support_vote.svg|16px]] [[Image:Symbol_oppose_vote.svg|16px]] [[Image:Symbol_oppose_vote.svg|16px]] [[Image:Symbol_neutral_vote.svg|16px]] [[Image:Symbol_neutral_vote.svg|16px]] [[Image:Symbol_unsupport_vote.svg|16px]] [[Image:Symbol_unsupport_vote.svg|16px]] :[[Image:Symbol_support_vote.svg|16px]] '''Support''' - he mere isi kwe nominee bu onye admin (''why you support the nominee'') ::[[Image:Symbol_unsupport_vote.svg|16px]] '''Discard''' - he mere isi cho i wefu vote gi (''why you are removing your support'') :[[Image:Symbol_oppose_vote.svg|16px]] '''Oppose''' - he mere ikweghi nominee bu onye admin (''why you oppose the nominee'') :[[Image:Symbol_neutral_vote.svg|16px]] '''Neutral''' - he ichoro iku maka uwa na nominee (''what you have to say about the matter'') ← explanation is mandatory with this vote
'''You can also use these templates:'''[[Image:Symbol_support_vote.svg|16px|Ee]] [[Template:Accept| Accept]]{{#if: {{{1|}}}|{{{1}}}}}{{subst:accept |''he ichoro iku''}}[[Image:Symbol_oppose_vote.svg|16px|Uh-uh]] [[Template:Oppose| Oppose]]{{#if: {{{1|}}}|{{{1}}}}}{{subst:oppose |''he ichoro iku''}}[[Image:Symbol_neutral_vote.svg|16px|Amaghi'm]] [[Template:Neutral| Comment]]{{#if: {{{1|}}}|{{{1}}}}}{{subst:neutral |''he ichoro iku''}}[[Image:Symbol_unsupport_vote.svg|16px|Wefu]] [[Template:Discard| Discard]]{{#if: {{{1|}}}|{{{1}}}}}{{subst:discard |''he ichoro iku''}}
==Onye Wikipedia mere nominate==
Time bu '''{{FULLDATE|type=wiki}}''' {| style="margin: 0 auto; font-size:smaller; background:none;" |'''[{{SERVER}}{{localurl:{{NAMESPACE}}:{{PAGENAMEE}}|action=purge}} Purge page cache] mgbe nominations adigi updated.''' |}
---- {{Wikipedia:Requests for adminship/Ukabia}} {{Wikipedia:Requests for adminship/Djsasso}} ----

{{#time:{{#switch:{{{type}}} |short = F j |shortish = M. j, Y |long = F j, Y H:i:s |day = l, d F Y |longer = l, d F Y H:i:s "([[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]])" |rfc-2822|r = r |iso-8601|c = c |wiki = H:i:s, [[j F]] [[Y]] "([[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]])" |medium |F j, Y }} |{{#if:{{{time|}}}|{{{time}}}|now}}}}<noinclude> ---- Returns the full or short English date at current time (UTC time, as set on the Wikipedia server).
; Syntax : <tt><nowiki>{{</nowiki>{{PAGENAME}}<nowiki>}}</nowiki></tt> : <tt><nowiki>{{</nowiki>{{PAGENAME}}<nowiki>|</nowiki>type=</tt>''type''<tt> <nowiki>}}</nowiki></tt> : The ''type''  can be <tt>short</tt>, <tt>medium</tt>, <tt>long</tt>, <tt>rfc-2822</tt> or <tt>iso-8601</tt>. For details see the [[{{TALKPAGENAME}}|talk page]].

Nde-na nwere ike change aha [[Wikipedia:Users|onye Wikipedia]]. Nde bureaucrats kwesiri ge he nde Wikipedia nile vote-iri na [[Wikipedia:Requests for Adminship|page aji nwe vote]] mgbe adgi me onye Wikipedia nke ukwu. {{nde-ukwu}} [[Category:Wikipedia]]

revision.text:
'''Ogbunabali''' bụ otu alusi-ukwu ndï Igbo omenala, ndi n'ekpe ekpere chi ''Ọdịnanị'', nke ndi [[bekee]] na-kpo ''animists''. Na echiche ndi Igbo animists, Ogbunabali bu alusi nke n'egbu ndi mmadu. Ha che [[Chukwu]]-wo kere ihe lile, kere onwe ya na asato kawasi ihe otu ya nile g'emee.
==Lee nke özö== * [[Chukwu]]
[[Òtù:Odinani]]
[[en:Ogbunabali]]

'''Nde-ukwu''' bụ nde lekotawa Wikipedia, meya nma-nma. Nde-ukwu nwere level isii:
{{Nde-ukwu}}

Nde users bu onye Wikipedia i nwere ike de he na Wikipedia. Nde ozo bu nde-ukwu Wikipedia.
'''Onye Wikipedia:''' [[m:banned user|banned user]] - [[m:bot|bot]] - [[m:anonymous user|ip user]] - [[m:registered user|registered user]] | '''[[Wikipedia:Nde-ukwu|Nde-ukwu]]:''' [[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrator]] - [[Wikipedia:Bureaucrats|bureaucrat]] - [[m:Oversight|oversight]] - [[m:CheckUser_policy|checkuser]] - [[Wikipedia:Stewards|steward]] - [[m:Developers|developer]]

N'echiche Igbo site n'ezi obodo, Chukwu bụ eze ndï chi na ndï uwa. Aha ya nonyere "chi" la "ukwu". Chukwu bụ onye mere he nile (chi- n'eke). Ka bụ nke ana-kpo ya ''[[Chineke]]'' ugbua. Chukwu abughi nwoke, abughi nwanyï. Mgbe ndï bekee bïara, nwe kporo Chukwu chi nke ndi Christian, me ya nke nwoke.
Ka bụ nke ndï Igbo nnuku bụ Christians ugbua.
[[Ébéonọr:Odinạnị]]
==Lee nke özö== * [[Chineke]] * [[Ekwensu]] * [[Ahia Njoku]]

revision.comment: Clean up, month names etc. using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{|align="right" |- |[[Usòrò:Igbo people.jpg|300px]]
[[Olaudah Equiano|O. Equiano]] • [[Jaja of Opobo]] • [[Chinua Achebe]] • [[Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie|C.N. Adichie]]
|} N'ala [[Naigeria]], '''ndï Igbo''' bu ndi ato hiri nne na onu agugu. Asusu eji mara ndiigbo bu asusu olu igbo. Nke ọzọ bu "broken [[bekee|English]]" ha ne ku ufọdi. Imerime mmadu nasu asusu bekee, site na-enyemaka nke amumamu olu bekee. Ufodi state ndi Igbo na Naigeria nọ nke nnuku bu, [[Abia State]], [[Anambra State]], [[Ebonyi State|Ebonyi]], [[Enugu State|Enugu]], ma na [[Imo State]]. [[Delta State]] (Anioma) na [[Rivers state]]. ==Ákíkó== Site n'otu esi kọwa na nke mbu, na ala [[Naigeria]], ndi Igbo no na Abia, Anambra, Ebonyi, Enugu and Imo state. Enwekwara ndi Igbo na Delta state nakwa Rivers state. A guba ndi kasi n'onu ogu na Naijiria, ndi Igbo bu ndi nke ato. Dika onu ogu afo 2007 siri kowa, ndi Awusa weresia, ndi Yoruba ewere, tupu o ruo ndi Igbo. Onweghi onye ma ndi Igbo ole bi n'uwa a, maka na ndi Igbo gbasara mba di iche iche; na-azu ahia, ma o bu na-agu akwukwo. N'ime Naijiria, ndi Igbo bi na steti dum. Ebe ha si pua njem, bu Omambala (nke a kporo Anambra); Abia; Enugwu; Ebonyi nakwa Imo. Ndi Igbo jukwara eju bara a bara na Delta; Rivers, ufodu akuku Edo, Akwa Ibom, Cross River, Bayelsa nakwa Benue. Ebe ndi Igbo gboro kasa na-abughi ala nna ha, bu Lagos, Kano, Kaduna na steti dum di na Naijiria). Ndi Igbo bu ndi njem. I ruo obodo di iche iche na [[Afrika]], [[Yurop]], [[Amerika]] ma o bu [[Eshia]], i ga-ahu imilikiti ndi Igbo. Onwere onye agbata obi siri, na obodo ndi Igbo anǫghi, abughi ezi obodo. Obodo obuna ndi Igbo nǫ, i fa na-enwe ǫgbakǫ ųmų-Igbo. Ǫgbakǫ ndia na-enye aka įfu na ǫmenani Igbo ma ǫdinma ndi-Igbo na-aga n'iru. ==Literature== * Chidi Leonard Ilechukwu: ''Igbo - Indigenous Economy and the search for Sustainable Development in Post Colonial African Society''. Cidjap Press, Enugu 2008, ISBN 978-978-087-181-9. ==Lee nke özö== * [[Asusu Igbo]] [[Òtù:Ìgbo]]

[[Olusegun Obasanjo]] • [[:en:King Sunny Adé|King Sunny Adé]] • [[:en:Wole Soyinka|Wole Soyinka]] • [[:en:Fela Kuti|Fela Kuti]] . [[:en:Funmilayo Ransome-Kuti|Funmilayo Ransome-Kuti]]
|} '''Ndi Yoruba''' bu ndi abuo hiri nne na onu agugu n'ala [[Naigeria]]. Hã bi na Naigeria na nke nnukwu, nonyere na Ekiti, [[Lagos State]], Ogun, Ondo, Osun, ma Oyo State. Olu ha na kwu bu olu Yoruba, nke ha na kpo ''èdèe Yorùbá''. ==Lee nke özö== * [[Ndị Igbo]] * [[Ndi Haụsa]] [[Òtù:Naigeria]]

revision.text:
Umaru Yar'Adua
[[Usòrò:Umaruyaradua07052007.jpg|155px]]
----
13th [[President of Nigeria]]
'''In office'''
[[29 Mee]], [[2007]]
Vice President(s) [[Goodluck Jonathan]]
Preceded by [[Olusegun Obasanjo]]
Succeeded by ''Incumbent''
Born [[9 Julaị]], [[1951]]
[[Katsina State]], [[Nigeria]]		 Died [[5 Mee]], [[2010]]
[[Abuja]], [[Nigeria]]
Political party [[People's Democratic Party]]
Spouse Turai Umaru Yar'adua
Religion [[Islam]]
'''Umaru Yar'Adua''' bu onye e mere [[President of Naigeria|president]] Naigeria, soto [[Olusegun Obasanjo]]. O bidoro [[29 Mee]], [[2007]], bu onye [[People's Democratic Party]] ('''PDP'''), ndi meriri e meri na general election 2007 Naigeria, na 21 Eprel. Mbu ha biata People's Democratic Party, ha bula onye ndi [[People's Redemption Party]], tupu ha so papa ya, onye bula vice chairman nde [[National Party of Nigeria]] (Naigeria). ==Akuko banyere {{PAGENAME}}== Amuru Umaru na Katsina State, Naigeria, bu nke ekeputara n' Kaduna State n'aro 1987. Nne na Nna ya kwuru n'amuru ya nime abali iteghete, onwa nke asaa n'ime aro 1951. Osoro Nna ya nke bu onye n' esote onye isi nke National Party nke Niagiria, buru otu onye n'ime ndi no na party ahu. N'ime aro 1999, emekwara ya onye isi ochi-agha nke Katsina State site na itu-aka nke oritere na [[People's Democratic Party]] (PDP). Nihi ochichi oma nke ya, emekwara ka ochia obodo Katsina aro asato. Site n' itu aka nke emere n'obodo niagiria nime onwa ano,abali iri abua n'otu, afo 2007, Umaru bu onye meriri ndi ozo dika Buhari, Atiku, [[Chukwuemeka Odumegwu Ojukwu|Ojukwu]], Oji Uzo, Rev Okotie na ndi ozo burukwa onye ebikwasiri aka koburu onye isi ochiagha nke Niagiria. Emere ya onye is ochiagha nke Nigira n'ime abali iri abua na iteghete,onwa ise, afo 2007.Owee burukwa onye isi ochiagha nke Niagiria nke iri n'ato. Obu ya nochiri onodu Olusegun Obasanjo. Oguru akwukwo n' mahadum, burukwa onye nkuzi n'ulo akwukwo nke ukwu nke di n' Zaria tupu obanye ndoro ndoro. Onwere otu nwanyi na otutu umuntakiri. ==Lee nke ozo== * [[Olusegun Obasanjo]] [[Òtù:President of Naigeria]]

revision.comment: /* Lee nke ọzọ */Usòrò, Òtù, minor fixes using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
'''Naija''' bụ ọtu aha ozo ndi ala Nigeria ([[Naigeria]]) di kpo ala ebe ahu. Onu nke "broken english". Nke ezioku, ''naija'' nwere-ike bu otu a ne de, kpo ''[[Niger]]'' maka otu nde ala-a di kwu okwu. Kama a kpo Niger hahu, ndi mmadu si aha Naigeria, ke nwetara na ndi [[bekee]], bu "[[Niger]]" na "area" (ebe ala), ha kpowazie Nigeria, ''naija''.
Ihe adi-kpo Naija bu nnukwu. Naija nwere music otu nke ya na website ndi mmadu ne me visit.
==Lee nke ọzọ== * [[Niger]] * [[Naigeria]]
[[Òtù:Naigeria]]

==Lee nke ozo== * [[Naija]]

[[Conservatism]] |- |'''Colours:'''|| [[Green]], [[White]], [[Red]] |- |} '''People's Democratic Party (PDP)''' bu otu n'ime otutu otu ndoro ndoro ochichi no n'ime gomenti [[Naigeria]]. Ndi na ruru ukwu na ya. Obu ha meriri na ndoro ndoro ochichi gara aga 2007. [[Umaru Yar'Adua]] bu onye nke ha. Ndi People's Democratic Party merikwara na ntuli aka ochichi 1999 na 2003. ==Lee nke ozo== * [[List of political parties in Nigeria|''Political parties'' no la Naigeria]] * [[Umaru Yar'Adua]] * [[Olusegun Obasanjo]] [[Òtù:Ọtú ndọ-ndọ nor na Naigeria]]

Goodluck Jonathan
[[Usòrò:Goodluck Jonathan at the Nuclear Security Summit 2010.jpg|200px]]
----
[[President of Nigeria]]
'''In office'''
[[29 Mee]], [[2007]]
President(s) [[Umaru Yar'Adua]]
Preceded by [[Atiku Abubakar]]
Succeeded by ''Incumbent''
Born [[1957]]
[[Bayelsa State]], [[Naigeria]]
Political party [[People's Democratic Party]]
'''Goodluck Jonathan''' bu onye e mere Vice President [[Naigeria]] (enyi President Naigeria) na ''inauguration'' emere na 28 Mee 2007. Ya na [[Umaru Yar'Adua]] bu ndi [[People's Democratic Party]]. ==Mbido Uwa Ya, Agum Akwukwo Ya, na Uwa Nke Ya== A muru Jonathan na [[Otueke]] n'ime [[Ogbia]] Local Government Area n'ebe a na-akpo [[Rivers]] na mgbe ochie, buru [[Bayelsa State]] n'afo 27 Novemba 1957. O luru nwanyi; aha nwunye ya bu Patience.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title= Money Laundering: I’m Not Involved, Says Bayelsa Governor |url=http://www.efccnigeria.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1026&Itemid=2 |work=Thisday, via EFCCNigeria.org |publisher= Leaders & Company |date=2006-09-12 |accessdate=2007-09-22 }} ==References== {{References}} ==Lee nke ozo== * [[Umaru Yar'Adua]] * Lawson Heyford, [["Jonathan: A Colossus at 49"]], The Source (Lagos), 11 Disemba 2006 * [["Money Laundering: I’m Not Involved, Says Bayelsa Governor"]]. Thisday, via EFCCNigeria.org (Leaders & Company). 2006-09-12. Retrieved on 2007-09-22. {{ÉdéNtạ}}

Atiku Abubakar
[[Usòrò:Wwwjjan3.jpg]]
[[Vice President of Nigeria]]
'''In office'''
[[29 Mee]], [[1999]] - [[29 Mee]], [[2007]]
President(s) [[Olusegun Obasanjo]]
Preceded by [[Mike Akhigbe]]
Succeeded by [[Goodluck Jonathan]]
Born [[25 Novemba]], [[1946]]
[[Adamawa State]], [[Nigeria]]
Political party [[Action Congress]]
Religion [[Islam]]
'''Alhaji Atiku Abubakar''' (nke amuru Turakin Adamawa), bula onye ''vice president'' Naigeria. Obu onye party [[Action Congress]] ==Lee nke ozo== * [[Olusegun Obasanjo]] * [[Goodluck Jonathan]] {{ÉdéNtạ}}
logo of an organization for Wikipedia (Action Congress) {{delete|dubious/wrong/no license}}

{| class="toccolours" border="1" cellpadding="4" style="float: right; margin: 0 0 1em 1em; width: 20em; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%; clear: right;" |+ '''Action Congress''' |- |style= align="center" colspan="2"| [[Usòrò:ACLogo.JPG|130px]] |- |'''Established:'''|| [[2005]] |- |'''Headquarters:'''|| Plot 779 Ona Crescent, Off Lake Chad Crescent, Maitama, [[Abuja]] |- |'''National Chairman:'''||[[Hassan M. Zurmi]] |- |'''National Secretary:'''||[[Bumi Omoseyindemi]] |- |'''National Treasurer:'''|| |- |'''Ideology:'''|| [[Moderate]]
[[Conservatism]] |- |'''Àgwà:'''|| [[Ọchándụ]], [[Ójie]], [[Ọchá]] |- |} '''Action Congress''' bu otu Ọtú ndọ-ndọ na [[Naigeria]], nde di kasiri he na government. [[Atiku Abubakar]] bu onye wo. ==Lee nke ozo== * [[List of political parties in Nigeria|''Political parties'' no la Naigeria]] * [[Atiku Abubakar]] * [[People's Democratic Party]] '''Schlüsseldienst München Sendling''' Der Schlüsseldienst aus München Sendling hilft Ihnen gerne weiter. Wir verbauen Sicherheitsprodukte, Schließtechnik und Schließanlagen. Wir vom [http://www.schluesseldienst-muenchen.info/sendling/ Schlüsseldienst München Sendling] bieten zudem einen 24 Stunden Schlüsselnotdienst an und öffnen Autotüren, Haustüren und Tresortüren in München Sendling preiswert, professionell, schnell und fair. {{ÉdéNtạ}} [[Òtù:Ọtú ndọ-ndọ nor na Naigeria]]

'''Békè''' bu [[mkpurokwu]] ana-kpo [[ndi ocha]]. Obu kwa he ana-kpo asüsü wo. Mgbe onye [[Scotland]] nwoke ana-kpo [[William Baike]] biara n'[[Igboland]], ogwara ndi madu n'aha ya bula Baike. Maka otu [[ndị Inglish]] di su asusu ha, mgbe [[ndị Igbo]] suoro ya, o dila ike. Ha kpowa 'Baike' 'bekee', kpowazie ndi ocha enyi ya, ndi bekee.
==Lee nke ozo== * [[Obodoézè Nà Ofú]] (''United Kingdom'') * [[Obodo Békè]]
[[Òtù:Obodo]]

[[Usòrò:LocationEurope.png|thumb|250px|Europe (obodo ndi bekee) n'uwa.]] [[Usòrò:Europe satellite orthographic.jpg|thumb|250px|Onyonyo Obodo bekee]] [[Usòrò:Rectified Languages of Europe map.png|thumb|250px]]
'''Obodo [[Békè']]''' bu he ndi Igbo kpowa ala ukwu ndi ocha ana-kpo '''Europe'''. O soto [[Asia]] na [[Afrịka]] n'imerime madu bi la ya.
==Lee nke ozo== * [[Asia]] * [[Afrịka]] * [[Amerika]]
===Ala no na obodo bekee=== :* [[Jémanị]] :* [[Finland]] :* [[Poland]] :* [[Mpaghara Russia]] :* [[Yukrain]] :* [[Obodoézè Nà Ofú]]
:* [[www.myderma.de]] Kryolipolyse, dauerhafte Haarentfernung Laser, Microneedling, Cellulite Behandlung, Fett weg, Narben entfernen Faltenbehandlung Berlin, Hamburg, München

revision.text:
{{Ndọndȯ Naigeria}} Nigeria dị nkéji 36 na Abuja, ama íshí ochié. Nkeji á kèjịrị kwà na ihe ha na kpo ''Local Government Areas'' nke 774.
Mgbe ndi Nigeria enwéghị owéré ha na ógè di 1960 mbu, Nigeria nwèrè nkeji àtó: Northern Region, Western Region, na Eastern Region.
<!-- this entire section will be translated before it is shown: In 1963, two provinces were detached from the '''Western Region''' to form the new ''Mid-Western Region''. In 1967, the regions were replaced by 12 states due to a military decree; only the former Mid-Western Region escaped division, and formed a single state following the restructuring. From 1967 to 1970 the areas of Mid-Western State and the Eastern Region attempted to secede, as [[Biafra]]. In 1976, seven new states were created, making 19 altogether; the [[Federal Capital Territory|Federal Capital Territory]] (now called [[Abuja]]) was established also. In 1987 two new states were established, followed by another 9 in 1991, bringing the total to 30. The latest change, in 1996, resulted in the present number of 36 states. -->
==Nkeji nọr na Obodo na FCT== {{Nigeria states map}} ==Lee nke ozo== * [[List of Nigerian state capitals]] * [[List of Nigerian state governors]] * [[List of Nigerian state nicknames]] * [[List of Nigerian states by date of statehood]] * [[List of Nigerian states by area]] * [[List of Nigerian states by population]]
